newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Hibernian says expects continued growth.
newsitem.headline: Hibernian says expects continued growth.

text.p: Irish insurer Hibernian Group Plc said on Monday it expected continued growth in 1997 despite the competitive environment in which it operates.

"We are currently focusing on maximising our distribution capacity for our products in a changing marketplace and we anticipate continued growth as a result of these activities," chief executive Adrian Daly said in a results statement.

Hibernian reported a rise of 26 percent in operating profit to 14.1 million punts. Pre-tax profit rose to 18.4 million punts in the six months to June 1997 versus 13 million in the same period in 1996.

"We are operating in highly competitive environments in all our main markets," Daly said. "Considerable progress has been made in ensuring that the group is positioned to compete profitably in changing market conditions."
